title: [Large-scale] Advanced Mathematical Problem-Solving Project Utilizing Experience-Based Learning with Information Processing

context.prior_knowledge: High school mathematics fundamentals (functions, calculus, statistics) and basic understanding of programming languages (Python)
context.additional_context: Data analysis and mathematical modeling projects for real-life problem-solving, with experiential learning reinforced through team collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can build 2 mathematical models using real workplace data (e.g., production line efficiency, inventory management data), systematically analyze results following a 4-stage process (problem definition, modeling, verification, solution proposal), present findings, and achieve at least 3 points (out of 5) on an evaluation rubric (model appropriateness, data usability, logical consistency).

In 3-person project teams, learners can perform data collection (from at least 2 sources), processing (using Excel/statistical tools), and interpretation (visualization and trend analysis) with a given dataset, reflect the experiential learning cycle (experience-reflection-conceptualization-application) in 1-page reports per stage, and submit final project deliverables.

Learners submit three individual portfolios documenting their mathematical thinking processes and problem-solving strategies during the mid-term course (4 weeks) and achieve scores meeting at least four out of five self-assessment checklist items and three out of four peer-assessment rubric items.

resources: Online data analysis tool (Google Colab, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
